question: What is product license key for deployment manager (dm)?

Deployment Manager license error:
DM license does not support BLE communication with the Tag
answer:
Error: Tag's configuration information cannot be retrieved.
The DM license does not support BLE communication with the Tag.

Resolution:

1. Open Deployment Manager (DM).
2. Click the Gear icon in the top-right corner.
3. Select Product Key from the menu.
4. When prompted, enter the product key PERF2197.
5. Verify the status shows 'Active Product Key' with a valid date.

Once activated, Deployment Manager will support managing tags using TED and BLE.

question: How to RMA
answer:
On the ticket, click "Change to RMA".

Pick Product Solutions Returned – RTLS or Patient Security (based on product).

Set RMA Type to Unk unless you know the correct value.

Assign the ticket to the RTLS Sales Operation queue for RTLS.

For Patient Security, assign to the appropriate Sales Ops group (WG, Arial, etc.).

question: License Key for HM – Hardware Manager License
Batch Reporting Tool for log file
answer:
Windows System Report (MobileView) — Batch Tool

What this captures

• MobileView logs and Apache logs
• Windows Event Logs (System, Application, etc.)
• Installed programs, running tasks, and startup items
• Firewall rules, IP configuration, and netstat snapshot
• Windows Update history
• AeroScout ProgramData/AppData artifacts (e.g., Instant Notifier, client logs)
• Hostname and timestamp included in the output filename for clear identification

Location of the tool
On the MobileView server:
<MobileView Install Dir>\tools\TSO_PSO\Windows System Report\

File name
WindowsSystemReport.bat

Internal Engineer Procedure (demo for staff)
1. Log into the MobileView server (RDP or console) with administrator rights.
2. Browse to:  <MobileView>\tools\TSO_PSO\Windows System Report\
3. Right-click WindowsSystemReport.bat and select Run as administrator.
4. Wait while the tool collects logs and creates a ZIP file.
5. Locate the output ZIP file on the Desktop.
6. File naming format:  HOSTNAME_logs_v1.8_YYYYMMDD_HHMM.zip
7. Upload the ZIP file to the support ticket.

Customer-Facing Instructions (copy/paste)
Subject: MobileView — Windows System Report (log collection)

Hi,

Please run the built-in Windows System Report tool on your MobileView server and upload the results:

1. Sign into the MobileView server using an administrator account.
2. Navigate to the following folder:
  <MobileView>\tools\TSO_PSO\Windows System Report\
3. Right-click WindowsSystemReport.bat and select Run as administrator.
4. Wait for the process to complete (a ZIP file will appear on the Desktop).
5. Attach the ZIP file to this support ticket.

This tool is read-only. It collects MobileView and Apache logs, Windows Event logs, installed applications, and network/system information to help us troubleshoot issues efficiently.
